intro: Neocodon turczaninovii, commonly known as the Turczaninov's neocodon, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
